summary: Tax whistleblowers who report on the underpayment of taxes by others have helped IRS collect $3.6 billion since 2007. Whistleblowers can claim awards of between 15 and 30 percent of the proceeds that IRS collects as a result of their information. However, before 2018, IRS wasn't required to pay whistleblowers for information that led to the collection of Foreign Bank and Financial Accounts penalties. Congress...
title: Whistleblower Program: IRS Needs to Improve Data Controls for Some Award Determinations
